intro: Buchnera mossambicensis, commonly known as the African bog moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and dark green, ovate leaves that are often covered in small, translucent oil glands. This moss typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. It is native to southern Africa, particularly in countries like Mozambique and South Africa. Buchnera mossambicensis plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its natural habitat.
